result.execSummary:
The defendant Kraig D Grauvogl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kraig D Grauvogl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kraig D Grauvogl was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Kraig D Grauvogl was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and stayed, w/Huber and Jail Diversion

miscConds.notes: $243 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  Court authorized payment plan.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No bars, taverns or liquor stores or any other business whose primary business is the sale of alcohol.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  DNA on file.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kraig D Grauvogl

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:13 AM Defendant Kraig D Grauvogl in court with Attorney William Ginsberg.  ADA Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 2 and 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #2      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 45 days in the DCJ, with Huber and Jail Diversion 

-Stayed for 12 months probation cc to count 3

COUNT #3      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 45 days in the DCJ, with Huber and Jail Diversion

-Stayed for 12 months probation cc to count 2

CONDITIONS:
-Absolute Sobriety 
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
- No bars, taverns or liquor stores or any other business whose primary business is the sale of alcohol 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2 and 3
-All CC, and V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved
-DNA surcharge waived. 

-Days credit for time already served: 1 day credit 
-Days credit if revoked: 1 day credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent to DOC

Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
